bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: This diary is probably of the same Mary Jordan of Harrisonburg whose Civil War diary was transcribed in 1961, which can be found in Carrier Library at Spec. Coll. F 234.H3H37.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Dated from January 1 to October, 1879. Entries are brief and mention weather, daily activities such as church attendance, visits from relatives and friends, travel of relatives to Baltimore, and getting loads of wood and barrels of flour. Occasional items of local news are also mentioned, such as court days, trials, and births, marriages, and deaths. On the first page is written: "Mary Jordan born in 17 hundred and 98 and this is 1879 I am still here."
